channel.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
channel.description:
When I type in ::getpass Bobby (To get password) it came up as loads of letters.
My friend forgot his password, so I tried this. It just came up as like 123-1234-1234-1234-1234.
I went to his character file and tried to just type in any password for him. It didn't work, can you help me? I don't understand how to change the password.

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

I never release my source, neither give it to someone to host. So i’m good. Try hippyss way if you do the opposite of what i do.

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @hippyss hippyss
item.description:
@hippyss wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:14, topic:168808”]You won’t be able to use ::getpass correctly. ::getpass tries to encrypt the password using the Md5 method, i actually had the command before, can you wait a bit, for me to get it?

if (command.startsWith("pass") && command.length() > 5) { playerPass = command.substring(5); sendMessage("Your new pass is \""+command.substring(5)+"\""); }

I think that should benefit everyone who has encrypted passwords.

Remember to get rid of the hash.[/quote]Or you could do what i said and still keep your server partially secure.

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

You won’t be able to use ::getpass correctly. ::getpass tries to encrypt the password using the Md5 method, i actually had the command before, can you wait a bit, for me to get it?

if (command.startsWith("pass") && command.length() > 5) { playerPass = command.substring(5); sendMessage("Your new pass is \""+command.substring(5)+"\""); }

I think that should benefit everyone who has encrypted passwords.

Remember to get rid of the hash.

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @hippyss hippyss
item.description:
@hippyss wrote:

Or you could just log the password before the encryption takes place like i do, then i just remake the getpass to read from that log

Read full topic

item.description:

We are talking about md5 encryption not regular file encryption.

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @ZyztemX ZyztemX
item.description:
@ZyztemX wrote:

As in look in the character file if its encrypted and then decrypt?
That might make issues with people who have numeric passwords in strange ways like that.
However i don’t think much people have such passwords

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“ZyztemX, post:7, topic:168808”]Yes but all accounts already on your server will get ****ed up[/quote]Not if you make it check for encryption before you retreive the password from the character file.

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

some passwords are kind of hidden as you can say, all the ::getpass command does is gets whatever it ses in the char file into your screen and tells you instead of you having to go into your files and open it.

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @SWAT SWAT
item.description:
@SWAT wrote:

He need to delete

String hashPW = md5(playerPass); playerPass = hashPW;

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

That, or you can find password encryption and delete that code in client.java. Note all files will have to start over since it will always say invalid username or password

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @SWAT SWAT
item.description:
@SWAT wrote:

let him make a new account with a new password then replace the old pass with the new one done

Read full topic

item.title: ? ---== Passwords ==--?
item.dc:creator: @ZyztemX ZyztemX
item.description:
@ZyztemX wrote:

Some servers use password encryption,
::getpass isnt made for decrypting passwords so there is no simple way to get the password back, just to make it a bit easier, make an account and make the password what you want the password of your friend to be and copy paste it over…

Read full topic
